content.description: Follow the juggy left  most crack straight up top top out.
content.protection: Short falls on soft ground, bring a pad
content.location: From the POC, follow trail. The first boulder on your right has ZIp, The crack is on the far left.

content.description: From the lower slopers, move up to large seam and into the crimps just below the lip. Top out carefully!
content.protection: The top out is a bit sketchy, bring a bad and a good spotter
content.location: From Huck of the Irish Boulder, head straight and off trail. Go downhill and you'll spot a boulder that is larger than the rest.

content.description: Start on Zip's start. Follow bottom seam until you reach the point where the rock sticks out on the seam (about halfway to the point where the two seams intersect) and go straight up to crimpers about a foot below the top. You may have to dyno that move. Top out is difficult but doable. Either try to mantel the top out or heel hook to the right and roll to top out (hence the name).
content.location: Located on same boulder as Zip and Beached Whale. Follow POC trail and it's the first boulder on the right.

content.description: Follow same seam as Huck but before instead of topping out, follow seam through slopers (Can be wet) to finish on big flake.
content.location: Same approach as Huck of the Irish

content.description: After pulling of the start follow the juggy and slopey seam about half way. Pull off the seam into a few more jugs before an uncomfortable but doeable topout.
content.location: Second large boulder on the left. Start on the chalked jugs in the small overhung area. The start is marked by brower rock.

content.description: From the start of Huck, go straight up to jugs, top out. A good warm-up
content.location: Same boulder as Huck of The Irish

content.description: From the start of Zip, follow the seam that is parallel with the ground, as it merges with the opposite seam, head up onto crimps and top out looking like a clumsy whale
content.location: This is the same boulder and start as Zip

content.description: Shady rocks, pefect for a warm fall day. Low somewhat contrvied routes on nice, occasionally chossy rock. Clean and mostly dry rocks. Never crowded.
